reviews.text: Have you noticed the number of reviewers who stress the Epinal's location? Even those who acknowledge that the rooms are in need of renovation then pirouette to the location angle and give it four stars. (There seems to be a very low standard on Tripadvisor for four stars.)
reviews.title: Worst hotel ripoff in Macedonia?

reviews.text: Let's just get the location aspect off the table: downtown Bitola is somewhat compact, and there are many excellent hotels and guest houses within a five minute walk of the main pedestrian mall.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: The Epinal's standard room is extremely cramped. (My luggage took up almost all the free space around the bed - actually two twin beds pushed together with a sheet on top. I found that out when I discovered the edges of the beds protruding into my back.) My room was also very hot (33 degrees C?), so at night (when it was freezing outside) I had to open my window. And like almost every hotel in Eastern Europe, they put a down duvet on your bed and that's it. No top sheet, no blanket, just a duvet. So you're either too warm with the duvet or too cold it you remove it.
reviews.title: Wine and octopus

reviews.text: The breakfasts were merely adequate, and the entire hotel has a worn-out look and feel.
reviews.title: This is their 4 star!
Your best option in Bitola
reviews.text: To get to the elevator (and your room) from the lobby, you climb three flights of stairs to go from the ground floor to the first floor. Then you turn left through a door, and walk 40 meters to the elevator. That's a long way to go, hauling your luggage up the stairs. And a long way if you are handicapped.
